TrcFtcLib.ftclib

Class FtcI2cDeviceReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.I2cDeviceReader
      • TrcFtcLib.ftclib.FtcI2cDeviceReader

  • public class FtcI2cDeviceReader
extends com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.I2cDeviceReader
    This class extends I2cDeviceReader so we can add methods to retrieve different parameters of the reader.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor: Creates an instance of the object.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FtcI2cDeviceReader

        public FtcI2cDeviceReader(java.lang.String instanceName,
                          com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.I2cDevice device,
                          com.qualcomm.robotcore.hardware.I2cAddr i2cAddr,
                          int memStart,
                          int memLen)
        Constructor: Creates an instance of the object.
        Parameters:
        instanceName - specifies the instance name.
        device - specifies the I2C device this reader is created for.
        i2cAddr - specifies the I2C address of the device.
        memStart - specifies the start address of the register window to read from.
        memLen - specifies the length of the register window to read from.

        public int getMemLength()
        This method returns the memory block length to be read by the reader.
        Returns:

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
        This method checks if it is in the same time slice loop as before. If so, it will just returned the data cached from last time. Otherwise, it will retrieve a new data buffer from the device and update the cache with it.
        Returns:
        device data.

      • getDataTimestamp

        public double getDataTimestamp()
        This method returns the timestamp of the data cache.
        Returns:
        data cache timestamp.
